intro: Psychotria cauligera, commonly known as the cloud forest psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the humid regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical structure supports its role in the complex ecosystems of cloud forests, contributing to biodiversity and ecological balance.
